page.title: 03Newtyle Railway
page.content: Newtyle is best known for the railway.The Dundee to Newtyle railway ran over part of the Hatton Hill and down to what is now the Bulb farm.It was opened on the 16th.December 1831. The first carriages were two old stage coaches,one called{"Tally {Ho",}and they were fitted with wheels to suit the{gauge}of 4ft.6.5in. Horses pulled the train on the level parts and stationary steam engines pulled the train up and down the three inclines. The first steam engines which replaced the horses in 1833 were built by the{Carmichael brothers of Dundee and cost Â£3,700.They were called the {Earl of Wharncliffe and the Earl of {Airlie.}(Susan Mitchell P7)
